page.title: 05CHURCHES IN HELMSHORE.
page.content:
Around Helmshore there are six churches. In Irwell Vale there is an old chapel which used to be the church but is now a row of three cottages. It was a church until about a hundred years ago. When the people of the village grew rich they decided to build a new church; they did, and it is still used today.
{St. Thomas'}church is bigger than Irwell Vale church and is probably older.{St. Veronica's}is a Catholic church and looks more like a big house with a big garden.
In St. Thomas' churchyard there is a monument dedicated to William Turner, a local mill owner.
